abstracts.cdata!:
The Western Altiplano Natural Resources
            Management project supported both the Peace Accords and the
            Guatemala Country Assistance Strategy (CAS), prioritizing:
            (a) establishment of social cohesion and strengthening
            participatory decision-making processes; (b) poverty
            reduction in rural areas; (c) modernization of the public
            sector; and environment protection. The principal factors
            that led to the cancellation of the Western Altiplano
            Natural Resources Management Project were: (i)
            government's failure to gain consensus and obtain the
            legislative approvals required for project effectiveness
            prior to the national elections and change of
            administrations and (ii) the very difficult fiscal situation
            the new government inherited, requiring austerity measures
            that forced the sectoral ministries to reassess their priorities.
